meanings.definition: To eject saliva forcibly from one's mouth.
meanings.sent1: He was spitting out the watermelon seeds.
meanings.sent2: The baseball player was spitting sunflower seeds during the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat was spitting out the hairball in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The angry teacher was spitting out words of reprimand.
meanings.sent5: The fountain was spitting water high into the air.

meanings.sent1: Spitting is considered rude in many cultures.
meanings.sent2: He heard the loud sound of spitting on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The spitting contest at the fair was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The spitting of the rain against the window was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The spitting of the engine indicated a problem.

meanings.definition: A small amount of saliva ejected from the mouth.
meanings.sent1: There was a spitting of saliva on the mirror.
meanings.sent2: The baby's spitting made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The dog's spitting on the floor was quickly cleaned up.
meanings.sent4: The spitting of the fountain created a mist in the air.
meanings.sent5: The spitting of the raindrops on the leaves was calming.
